title: Punishment for Pirating, Destroying, or Altering Computer Source Data
description: If a person, knowingly or with malafide intention, pirates, destroys, or alters computer source code used for any computer, computer program, computer system, or computer network, or causes others to do so, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding Two Hundred Thousand Rupees or both.

penalty.fine: Up to Two Hundred Thousand Rupees

title: Punishment for Cyber Terrorism
description: Any person who commits cyber terrorism or causes harm to national security or public order through electronic means shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years or a fine up to 500,000 Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Unauthorized Access
description: If a person accesses a computer, computer system, or network without authorization and causes damage or disruption, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years or a fine up to 200,000 Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Publishing Offensive Material
description: If a person publishes or displays material against morals, etiquette, hatred, or malice on a computer, internet, and other electronic media, the culprit can be punished with a fine of 1 lakh rupees or imprisonment for up to 5 years or both.

title: Compensation for Damages
description: Any person convicted under this Act may be required to pay compensation for damages caused by their actions.

title: Compensation for Victims
description: Victims of cyber crimes may seek compensation through legal proceedings, and the courts may award damages based on the severity of the crime and the loss suffered.

title: Punishment for Unauthorized Access and Data Theft
description: Individuals convicted of unauthorized access to data or data theft may face imprisonment and fines as specified under the Child Rights Act of 2075.

title: Liability of Intermediaries
description: Intermediaries, such as online platforms, are not liable for user-generated content unless they fail to act upon receiving knowledge of the unlawful content.

title: Patent for Pharmaceuticals
description: This policy deals with the patenting of pharmaceutical products and modifications thereof. It involves determining the novelty and inventiveness of the drug for patent protection.

title: Citizen Data Protection
description: Guidelines and regulations for protecting Citizen data, including responsibilities of entities handling citizen information and measures for data security.

title: Punishment for Distribution of Illegal Pornographic Content
description: If a person distributes, shares, or sells pornographic content that is illegal under local laws, including content involving minors or non-consensual material, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years or a fine up to 1,000,000 Nepalese Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Facilitating Access to Pornographic Content by Minors
description: If a person facilitates, provides, or fails to prevent access to pornographic content to individuals under the age of 18, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years or a fine up to 500,000 Nepalese Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Creation and Distribution of Child Pornography
description: If a person creates, distributes, or possesses child pornography, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 15 years and a fine up to 2,000,000 Nepalese Rupees. This includes all forms of child exploitation material.

title: Punishment for Uploading and Sharing Pornographic Content on Social Media
description: If a person uploads, shares, or posts pornographic content on social media platforms without consent or in violation of the platform's terms, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years or a fine up to 750,000 Nepalese Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Production of Pornographic Content without Consent
description: If a person produces or records pornographic content involving individuals without their consent, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 8 years or a fine up to 1,500,000 Nepalese Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Unauthorized Access to Facebook Accounts
description: If a person gains unauthorized access to a Facebook account through hacking, phishing, or any other means, and uses or distributes the account's information unlawfully, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years or a fine up to 150,000 Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Cyber Harassment on Facebook
description: If a person uses Facebook to harass, intimidate, or threaten another individual, including sending abusive messages or posting harmful content, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 year or a fine up to 100,000 Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Online Fraud via Facebook
description: If a person commits fraud on Facebook, including creating fake profiles for financial gain, scamming users, or engaging in deceptive practices, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years or a fine up to 500,000 Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Data Breach and Privacy Violations on Facebook
description: If a person illegally accesses, shares, or uses private information obtained from Facebook without consent, leading to a breach of privacy, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years or a fine up to 300,000 Rupees or both.

title: Punishment for Spreading Misinformation or Fake News on Facebook
description: If a person spreads false information or fake news on Facebook with the intent to deceive or cause harm, leading to public disturbance or other adverse effects, he/she shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years or a fine up to 200,000 Rupees or both.
